title: Test suite will need to be able to handle SHA-1 signatures not being supported
body:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 will have SHA-1 signatures disabled by default:
https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/devel@lists.fedoraproject.org/thread/VVLHQAWI3IQ7NRLKMUHJ27JV3V2JAFDP/
This change is already visible in CentOS 9 Stream, which is where development of RHEL-9 is happening.
Building paramiko on CentoOS 9 Stream results in many test suite failures due to lack of SHA-1 signature support, like this one:
```
_______________________ SSHClientTest.test_auth_timeout ________________________

self = <tests.test_client.SSHClientTest testMethod=test_auth_timeout>

    @slow
    def test_auth_timeout(self):
        """
        verify that the SSHClient has a configurable auth timeout
        """
        # Connect with a half second auth timeout
>       self.assertRaises(
            AuthenticationException,
            self._test_connection,
            password="unresponsive-server",
            auth_timeout=0.5,
        )

tests/test_client.py:501: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
tests/test_client.py:205: in _test_connection
    self.tc.connect(**dict(self.connect_kwargs, **kwargs))
paramiko/client.py:406: in connect
    t.start_client(timeout=timeout)
paramiko/transport.py:698: in start_client
    raise e
paramiko/transport.py:2109: in run
    ptype, m = self.packetizer.read_message()
paramiko/packet.py:459: in read_message
    header = self.read_all(self.__block_size_in, check_rekey=True)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

    def read_all(self, n, check_rekey=False):
        """
        Read as close to N bytes as possible, blocking as long as necessary.
    
        :param int n: number of bytes to read
        :return: the data read, as a `str`
    
        :raises:
            ``EOFError`` -- if the socket was closed before all the bytes could
            be read
        """
        out = bytes()
        # handle over-reading from reading the banner line
        if len(self.__remainder) > 0:
            out = self.__remainder[:n]
            self.__remainder = self.__remainder[n:]
            n -= len(out)
        while n > 0:
            got_timeout = False
            if self.handshake_timed_out():
                raise EOFError()
            try:
                x = self.__socket.recv(n)
                if len(x) == 0:
>                   raise EOFError()
E                   EOFError

paramiko/packet.py:303: EOFError
----------------------------- Captured stderr call -----------------------------

[2614.0990257263184]	DEBUG:paramiko.transport:Local version/idstring: SSH-2.0-paramiko_2.10.1

[2625.075578689575]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:    self.kex_engine.parse_next(ptype, m)
[2625.105857849121]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:  File "/builddir/build/BUILD/paramiko-2.10.1/paramiko/kex_curve25519.py", line 62, in parse_next
[2625.1344680786133]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:    return self._parse_kexecdh_init(m)
[2625.1626014709473]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:  File "/builddir/build/BUILD/paramiko-2.10.1/paramiko/kex_curve25519.py", line 92, in _parse_kexecdh_init
[2625.1916885375977]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:    sig = self.transport.get_server_key().sign_ssh_data(
[2625.22029876709]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:  File "/builddir/build/BUILD/paramiko-2.10.1/paramiko/rsakey.py", line 126, in sign_ssh_data
[2625.253677368164]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:    sig = self.key.sign(
[2625.281572341919]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:  File "/usr/lib64/python3.9/site-packages/cryptography/hazmat/backends/openssl/rsa.py", line 501, in sign
[2625.3089904785156]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:    return _rsa_sig_sign(self._backend, padding, algorithm, self, data)

[2625.417947769165]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:    raise UnsupportedAlgorithm(
[2625.4451274871826]	ERROR:paramiko.transport:cryptography.exceptions.UnsupportedAlgorithm: sha1 is not supported by this backend for RSA signing.
```
